Package pathfinder.datastructures

Class Path<P>

java.lang.Object
pathfinder.datastructures.Path<P>
Type Parameters:
P - The generic type for path
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Path<P>.Segment>
public class Path<P> extends Object implements Iterable<Path<P>.Segment>
This represents an immutable path between two cartesian coordinate points, particularly Path#getStart() and Path#getEnd(). Also contains a cached version of the total cost along this path, for efficient repeated access.

    class 
    Path.Segment
    Segment represents a single segment as part of a longer, more complex path between points.

  • Constructor Details

    • Path

      public Path(P start)
      Creates a new, empty path containing a start point. Essentially this represents a path from the start point to itself with a total cost of "0".
      Parameters:
      start - The starting point of the path.

  • Method Details

    • extend

      public Path<P> extend(P newEnd, double segmentCost)
      Appends a new single segment to the end of this path, originating at the current last point in this path and terminating at newEnd. The cost of adding this additional segment to the existing path is segmentCost. Thus, the returned Path represents a path from this.getStart() to newEnd, with a cost of this.getCost() + segmentCost.
      Parameters:
      newEnd - The point being added at the end of the segment being appended to this path
      segmentCost - The cost of the segment being added to the end of this path.
      Returns:
      A new path representing the current path with the given segment appended to the end.

    • getCost

      public double getCost()
      Returns:
      The total cost along this path.

    • getStart

      public P getStart()
      Returns:
      The point at the beginning of this path.

    • getEnd

      public P getEnd()
      Returns:
      The point at the end of this path, which may be the start point if this path contains no segments (i.e. this path is from the start point to itself).

    • iterator

      public Iterator<Path<P>.Segment> iterator()
      Specified by:
      iterator in interface Iterable<P>
      Returns:
      An iterator of the segments in this path, in order, beginning from the starting point and ending at the end point. In the case that this path represents a path between the start point and itself, this iterator contains no elements. This iterator does not support the optional Iterator#remove() operation and will throw an UnsupportedOperationException if Iterator#remove() is called.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Checks this path for equality with another object. Two paths are equal if and only if they contain exactly the same sequence of segments in the same order. In the case that both paths are empty, they are only equal if their starting point is equal.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare with this.
      Returns:
      true if and only if obj is equal to this.
